channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report X-2024030170
item.description:
Report X-2024030170

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: OAK PARK
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While doing VSA, the box for the package was found damaged and leaked all over. 2 jugs of Morado supercleaner found in another part of the van but not the other 2. It is most likely that the other two jugs were the ones that leaked, and the driver threw them out before arriving at the terminal. The driver had already left when doing the VSA, so there want' a chance to ask the driver about what happened. DescribePack: 2 out of 4 jugs of Morado supercleaner completely leaked out. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Damaged box and contents were placed in a bin and sent to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2024030170
item.description:
Report E-2024030170

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: YPSILANTI
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 28, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1206 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1206-impacted trailer. All impacted material was collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024030126
item.description:
Report X-2024030126

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CONTENTS OF AN AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA TO THE USA WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A STRONG ACETONE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS, ONE CONTAINER OF LUMELI REMOVEDOR DE ESMALTE TRANSLATED AS LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER WAS FOUND LEAKING. THE LEAK WAS CONTAINED WITHIN THE PACKAGE WITH JUST A SMALL STAIN ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN PREVIOUSLY INSPECTED BY CUSTOMS OFFICIALS IN MIAMI PRIOR TO BEING RELEASED INTO THE UPS NETWORK. THERE IS "OPENED FOR CUSTOMS PURPOSES" TAPE SURROUNDING THE PACKAGE AND SURROUNDING THE LUMELI NAIL POLISH REMOVER INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE SCANS IN THE UPS NETWORK AS UPS SMALL PACKAGE TRACKING 1ZB6864V0423811919 BUT ALL THERMAL TRACKING LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE SHOW COLOMBIA NATIONAL POSTAL SERVICE, 4-72, TRACKING NUMBER CP0051323737CO. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM COLOMBIA USING UPS ACCOUNT B6864V, ANICAM COLOMBIA SAS, TV 93 #53-32 BODEGA 13, PARQUE EMPRESARIAL EL DORADO, BOGOTA DC 110911 COLOMBIA.

item.title: Report E-2024030141
item.description:
Report E-2024030141

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE TO THE OUTER BOX WAS A UN SPECIFICATION. WE THEN REVIEWED THE ATTACHED PACKING LIST ON THE OUTER BOX. UPON REVIEW OF THE PACKING LIST THE DESCRIPTION IS THINNER, PAIN PRODUCT. INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS TO FIND THREE X ONE GALLON CANS OF FLAMMABLE SOLVENT T-6095. EACH CAN HAS VISIBLE FLAMMABLE DIAMOND LABELS. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MICHIGAN USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A85F58, DCMA-FDT, 1222 SPRUCE ST, SAINT LOUIS MO 63103-2818.
